sense.name: decorate with frosting
sense.examples: In the center was the big birthday cake--iced as only Molly could ice it. She iced the top of the chocolate icing with pink icing saying "Happy Birthday." She iced the cake using a star tip. I glazed and iced the doughnuts then put them in the case. She also gives great tips on icing the cookies with fondant.

sense.name: make colder, or icy, using ice
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] ICE NP2[theme] (PP[instrument]) May be used metaphorically.
sense.examples: Ice your sprained limbs. Their plans were iced, however by temperatures that dipped into the teens. It has been iced, and the champagne has been standing in an equable temperature of 65. He is on the bench icing his knee during breaks. BC Buildings Corporation had also discontinued icing the rink in the winter time.
